intro: Meum athamanta, commonly known as field hawksbeard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow composite flowers, which are composed of numerous tiny florets arranged in a radiate pattern. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as fields and roadsides, and it is native to Europe and parts of Asia. Meum athamanta has hairy, linear leaves that are often glandular, and it produces achenes as its dry, indehiscent fruits. It is often considered a weed but also has historical uses in herbal medicine.
